At Fri, 26 Apr 2013 10:13:38 +0000,
Nicholas Clarke wrote:
> 
> https://bit=
bucket.org/nclarkekb/jwat-tools-solr
> 
> It includes WARC parsing and TIKA=
 metadata extraction. The SOLRJ code is commented out and does not include =
all fields.
> In some future it will be changed to use JSON SOLR REST API s=
ince SOLRJ is a joke (IMHO).
> With 12 parallel TIKA extractors it averaged=
 6TB/day on one of our test machines(24 cores, 99GB ram, 6TB storage). TIKA=
 could maybe be optimized using a RAMDISK for temp files/IO.
> 
> Anyway, a=
 semi complete project if you want to get your hands dirty.
> 
> A college =
did however succeed in using the tools Andy Jackson suggested. Probably the=
 safer route currently.

Also there is our version:

  https://bitbucket.or=
g/cdl/weari

Maybe we can all collaborate a bit on this work? I didn=E2=80=
=99t know there
were two other projects doing solr web archiving work.

Nic=
holas, what problems did you have with solrj? It=E2=80=99s worked fine for =
us.

best, Erik
